description:
Welcomed in by a tree lined multi-entry driveway, this attractive lifestyle property lifts the standard in country living, offering 14 acres of grassland, paddocks, manicured gardens captivated by stunning views across the Yarra Valley and is superbly positioned for the hobbyist, lifestyle or equine enthusiast.

Defined by charm, this single level residence was and constructed for the occupants to indulge in day-to-day family lifestyle. A welcoming and peaceful ambience is well achieved, highlighting breathtaking scenery enjoyed from the generous alfresco.

The layout of the home has been well created and executed, beginning with a galley style kitchen with gas cooktop, electric oven, dishwasher, generous pantry and fitted cabinetry with a separate meals zone creating a great indoor/outdoor entertaining space flowing through to the generous living space with views of the manicured yards, wood fireplace and split system heating/cooling for all seasons.

The master suite is positioned in a separate wing to the remainder of the bedrooms, equipped with generous natural light, magnificent views, walk-in robe and an ensuite with generous storage vanity, shower and toilet.

The further two bedrooms are generous in size, serviced by a central bathroom/laundry with a vanity with storage, shower and toilet whilst the laundry has generous bench space and cabinetry with an exit door to the decking space with further day-to-day storage.

The property occupies separate studio accommodation for multi generation living, guests or air B&B with a generous bedroom, living space, kitchen with great bench space and a bathroom with shower, vanity and toilet with parking and separate entrance via Settlement Road away from the main residence.

The tradesperson, car lover or equine enthusiast will appreciate the versatility available, with a generous storage shed, feed shed, multiple carports, tack room, multiple stables with concrete base, cottage style bungalow with power, woodshed and machinery shed.

The property is set up with multiple day yards positioned near the stables for convenience. A large sand track ideal for day-to-day exercise, harness or gallopers with a central paddock in the middle ready for cattle to graze or to be divided for horses, with a dam positioned at the rear of the block.

Perfectly positioned to the Yarra Junction township and only a short walk to the Upper Yarra Secondary College, St Joseph's School, Little Yarra Steiner School, Yarra Junction Primary School, Wesburn Primary School, buses, main street, cafes, restaurants and Warburton Highway.
